page.title: 17Fire-fighting in Swindon.
page.content: The local fire-brigade have had 1350 call-outs in the past year, of which 200 were hoax calls. The main types of fire are chimney fires in winter and grassfires in summer. The area covered is 60 square miles with 3 pumps, 1 turntable ladder, 1 emergency salvage vehicle and 16 fire-men. A special problem to the fire-service is the Murray John building in the town centre due to its height. The most unusual call out this month was to free a child from a plastic potty stuck on his head. Youngsters are often rescued by fire-men. The M4 Motorway runs close to Swindon and traffic accidents occur. Six people were killed recently in a multiple collision with firemen called out to cut people from the wreckage.
